page.title: 13 INTERVIEW WITH MUM
page.content: At school there were rows of desks and they had two to a desk. They used ink-wells and dip-in pens. They did a lot of work off the blackboard. Hardly anyone had a car because they couldn't afford one. A lot of the cars were black and most of the bicycles were heavier than they are today. The ladies wore stockings because tights had not been invented. Little boys wore shorts and only wore long trousers when they were about 13. People only had chicken at Christmas or Easter and there were no currys or frozen foods because nobody had a freezer. The entertainment was the cinema and the radio, there was no television in those days. The games were hide and seek, kick can turkey, rugby, train spotting, whip and top, tich, marbles, conkers and jacks.
